subject: Relationships
title: Bargaining: The 'What If' Trap
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Bargaining: The 'What If' Trap.

hook.text: 'If only I'd been more patient. If only I hadn't said that. Maybe we'd still be together.' The loop begins.

buildup.text: Bargaining is the brain's attempt to regain control by rewriting the past and imagining different outcomes.

discovery.text: It creates an illusion of agency: 'If I caused it, maybe I can fix it.' Control feels better than helplessness.

twist.text: Bargaining keeps you stuck in a fantasy past. Healing requires accepting reality, not editing history.

climax.text: You can't negotiate with the past. The only power you have is choosing what happens next.

punchline.text: 'What if' keeps you in the past. 'What now' moves you forward.

quiz.question: Why does the brain engage in bargaining after a breakup?
options: To regain a sense of control over the situation
